rule_text: The Lagna Bhava extends from the ascendant counterclockwise below the earth up to the 2nd cusp
The Second Bhava is between 2nd cusp and the 3rd cusp
Houses 9, 8 and 7 are above horizon and occupy the visible western horizon
Houses 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 are below horizon

In Vimshoddhari Dasa, each planet has specific years allotted: Ketu 7 years, Venus 20 years, Sun 6 years, Moon 10 years, Mars 7 years, Rahu 18 years, Jupiter 16 years, Saturn 19 years and Mercury 17 years
The Dasas are divided into 9 Bhuktis (sub periods) ruled by the 9 planets in cyclic order

Closer an aspect is, the stronger the result will be. An aspect or conjunction just within the range of orb is weak in power.
Moon is the fastest of all the planets, its daily motion being between 12 and 15 degrees. It can therefore apply to Mercury, Venus, Sun, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune.
Mercury moves between 66 minutes and 100 minutes of longitude per day and can therefore apply to all other planets except the Moon.
Venus travels at a rate between 62 and 82 minutes of longitude per day and will apply to Sun, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune.
Sun moves daily at a rate varying between 0°-57'-10" to 1°-1'-10" and can apply to all other planets except Moon, Mercury and Venus when Mercury and Venus have a greater speed.
Mars has a daily motion ranging between 31 and 44 minutes of celestial longitude and can therefore apply to Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune.
